title: Album Page, "Three Sketches: Building Details, Strasburg", August 16, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 5 / (inscribed in circle) 5; waterspout (copper) / hospital / Strassburg [sic] / (inscribed in circle) c; at center: Gable / Strasburg / Aug 16th 1887; upper left: chimneytop / Hospital / Strassburg [sic].
description: Vertical sheet with three sketches of details from buildings in Strasburg, clockwise from top left:view of a roofline corner with a slender chimneytop behind.  The chimneytop has blind panels interrupted by a projecting cornice, above which are two round-arched openings on the two visible façades.  Above this is another projecting cornice surmounted by two gables on either face; at right is a detail of a waterspout visible on a building façade.  The gutter projects from the building and a second piece in the shape of a dragon's head creates the mouth from which the water sprays.  This piece is tethered to the wall of the building by an intricate s-link chain and ornamental bracket.  Below is a three-story building with a prominent, tiled gable roof and multiple chimneys punctuating its roofline.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Three Sketches: Building Details, Strasburg", August 16, 1887.
August 16, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-90.
